info.title: Public App Crm Cards
info.description: Allows an app to extend the CRM UI by surfacing custom cards in the sidebar of record pages. These cards are defined up-front as part of app configuration, then populated by external data fetch requests when the record page is accessed by a user.
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: Add a custom card to contact records that displays data from your external bug tracking software.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Create custom cards to data from external systems on CRM records. Requires a public public app. These CRM cards are different from the UI extensions you can create with projects.

get.description: Returns an example card detail response. This is the payload with displayed details for a card that will be shown to a user. An app should send this in response to the data fetch request.
Returns a list of cards for a given app.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The ID of the target app.

post.description: Defines a new card that will become active on an account when this app is installed.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The ID of the target app.

get.description: Returns the definition for a card with the given ID.

parameters.name: cardId
parameters.description: The ID of the target card.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The ID of the target app.

delete.description: Permanently deletes a card definition with the given ID. Once deleted, data fetch requests for this card will no longer be sent to your service. This can't be undone.

parameters.name: cardId
parameters.description: The ID of the card to delete.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The ID of the target app.

patch.description: Update a card definition with new details.

parameters.name: cardId
parameters.description: The ID of the card to update.

parameters.name: appId
parameters.description: The ID of the target app.

requestBody.description: Card definition fields to be updated.

title.description: The top-level title for this card. Displayed to users in the CRM UI.

CardCreateRequest.description: State of card definition to be created

objectTypes.description: An array of CRM object types where this card should be displayed. HubSpot will call your target URL whenever a user visits a record page of the types defined here.

targetUrl.description: URL to a service endpoint that will respond with details for this card. HubSpot will call this endpoint each time a user visits a CRM record page where this card should be displayed.

CardFetchBodyPatch.description: Variant of CardFetchBody with fields as optional for patches

dataType.description: Type of data represented by this property.

name.description: An internal identifier for this property. This value must be unique TODO.

options.description: An array of available options that can be displayed. Only used in when `dataType` is `STATUS`.

label.description: The label for this property as you'd like it displayed to users.

CardDisplayProperty.description: Definition for a card display property.

objectTypes.description: An array of CRM object types where this card should be displayed. HubSpot will call your data fetch URL whenever a user visits a record page of the types defined here.

targetUrl.description: URL to a service endpoints that will respond with card details. HubSpot will call this endpoint each time a user visits a CRM record page where this card should be displayed.

CardFetchBody.description: Configuration for this card's data fetch request.

name.description: A CRM object type where this card should be displayed.

propertiesToSend.description: An array of properties that should be sent to this card's target URL when the data fetch request is made. Must be valid properties for the corresponding CRM object type.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate
message.example: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

label.description: The text that will be displayed to users for this option.

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

cardLabel.description: The label to be used for the `allItemsLinkUrl` link (e.g. 'See more tickets'). If not provided, this falls back to the card's title.

allItemsLinkUrl.description: URL to a page the integrator has built that displays all details for this card. This URL will be displayed to users under a `See more [x]` link if there are more than five items in your response, where `[x]` is the value of `itemLabel`.

totalCount.description: The total number of card properties that will be sent in this response.

sections.description: A list of up to five valid card sub categories.

IntegratorCardPayloadResponse.description: The card details payload, sent to HubSpot by an app in response to a data fetch request when a user visits a CRM record page.

properties.description: Card display properties. These will will be rendered as "label : value" pairs in the card UI. See the [example card](#) in the overview docs for more details.

CardDisplayBody.description: Configuration for displayed info on a card

title.description: The top-level title for this card. Displayed to users in the CRM UI.

CardPatchRequest.description: Body for a patch with optional fields

baseUrls.description: A list of URL prefixes that will be accepted for card action URLs. If your data fetch response includes an action URL that doesn't begin with one of these values, it will result in an error and the card will not be displayed.

CardActions.description: Configuration for custom user actions on cards.
